content:
Sure! There are several other examples of AHL players who went on to become NHL stars. Here are a few:

1. Mark Giordano - Giordano was an undrafted free agent who spent three seasons in the AHL before getting his chance in the NHL. He is now the captain of the Calgary Flames and has been named to three NHL All-Star Games.

2. Pekka Rinne - Rinne spent several seasons playing in the AHL before becoming the starting goaltender for the Nashville Predators. He has since won the Vezina Trophy as the NHL's top goaltender and has been named to three NHL All-Star Games.

3. Corey Crawford - Crawford was drafted by the Chicago Blackhawks in the second round of the 2003 NHL Entry Draft. He spent several seasons in the AHL before becoming the Blackhawks' starting goaltender and helping them win two Stanley Cups.

4. Gustav Nyquist - Nyquist spent parts of three seasons in the AHL before becoming a regular in the NHL. He has played for the Detroit Red Wings, San Jose Sharks, and Columbus Blue Jackets and has scored over 20 goals in a season twice.

These players all used their experiences in the AHL to develop their skills and gain valuable experience before becoming NHL stars.
